title: 5 uC triangle set - force change on bottom charges

content.description: Three identical <math alttext="positive 5 microcoulombs" display="inline" overflow="scroll" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><mpadded><mo>+</mo><mn>5.0</mn></mpadded><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><mi>Î¼C</mi></math> point charges are arranged at the corners of an equilateral triangle with side length <math alttext="0.50 meter" display="inline" overflow="scroll" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><mn>0.50</mn><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><mi mathvariant="normal">m</mi></math>, as shown in the figure.
content.question: The bottom two point charges exert forces of magnitude <math alttext="F" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>F</mi></math> on each other. If the distance between them is doubled, what is the new magnitude of the forces that these point charges exert on each other?

unit.text: 8: Electric Charges, Fields, and Gauss's Law

skill.text: 2.D: Predict new values or factors of change of physical quantities using functional dependence between variables.
